helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
To note,

The man left by 12:50 PM.

On Sun, Dec 14, 2025, 1:12 PM Jiral Waghela <jiralw@gmail.com> wrote:
Hi, 

My brother booked a blood test for me scheduled between 12:30 PM and 1:30 PM today. The technician arrived and collected my blood at around 12:40 PM.

However, I have been facing difficulty providing a urine sample for the past few months. I was only able to provide 5 ml, after which the technician became rude and insisted that the booking be cancelled. He mentioned that he would have to pay a penalty of ₹1,200, despite the clearly mentioned time slot of 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM.

He then started arguing, said he had another appointment at 1:00 PM, and left abruptly without informing us properly. He did not provide any confirmation, receipt, or documentation stating that the blood sample had been collected.

I am requesting a refund due to this extremely unprofessional behavior. Home testing is chosen for convenience and comfort. I have a history of fainting during blood tests or even at the sight of blood, which is why a home test was specifically booked.

notes.body_html:
Merged from ticket 22280411

Subject: Provide refund-

Description:
Hi, 

My brother booked a blood test for me scheduled between 12:30 PM and 1:30 PM today. The technician arrived and collected my blood at around 12:40 PM.

However, I have been facing difficulty providing a urine sample for the past few months. I was only able to provide 5 ml, after which the technician became rude and insisted that the booking be cancelled. He mentioned that he would have to pay a penalty of ₹1,200, despite the clearly mentioned time slot of 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM.

He then started arguing, said he had another appointment at 1:00 PM, and left abruptly without informing us properly. He did not provide any confirmation, receipt, or documentation stating that the blood sample had been collected.

I am requesting a refund due to this extremely unprofessional behavior. Home testing is chosen for convenience and comfort. I have a history of fainting during blood tests or even at the sight of blood, which is why a home test was specifically booked.

notes.body: Hello Girish,     Greetings from PharmEasy!  ​   With regards to your order #658828426260078592-43474, I understand your concern in regard to the refund amount.     The refund amount of Rs. 1483.30 was initiated on 13th December 2025, and it will be reflected in your payment source account within 5 to 7 business days (Excluding Saturday, Sunday & Bank Holidays).     For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the Need Help section. Alternatively, you can also call us on 08071324888.     Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy.     Regards,  Manisha
notes.body_html:
Hello Girish,

Greetings from PharmEasy!
​
With regards to your order #658828426260078592-43474, I understand your concern in regard to the refund amount.

The refund amount of Rs. 1483.30 was initiated on 13th December 2025, and it will be reflected in your payment source account within 5 to 7 business days (Excluding Saturday, Sunday & Bank Holidays).

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the Need Help section. Alternatively, you can also call us on 08071324888.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay healthy.

Regards,
Manisha
